Html: I was running through my items, trying to figure out what items I had available to run against rawr's optimize feature; however, I find it a bit hard remembering what I picked up and what still needs added.  Is there a tool available to create a list of items in-game and import these items to the list of available items in rawr?  Having a tool like this would help with keeping a list of available items, and/or craftable items available.

hm i have installed this add-on and klick ingame "c" to open my character, and the i clicked the save button.

What have i to do next?


Edit:

ok i have found the way to export.

after this steps, see above, u have to write ingame /cp export

Now there is a file generated in D:\Programme\World of Warcraft\WTF\Account\youracountname\SavedVariables. The file is named CharacterProfiler.lua.

Now u can open this file via rawr with "Import from CharacterProfiler".

But the add-on is out of date, many items were not showing in rawr, no glyhpes and no talents...

@ rawr programmers, can u create an updated version of character profiler and integrate this into rawr? That would be awesome, and save much time to export all epics into rawr :)
CharacterProfiler is not ours to update. That said, someone has been working on a Rawr addon (to act as an integration layer, not to do any calculations), though it may be a ways off.

any recent news on this 'Rawr version of CharacterProfiler'?

just curious.
Nope, I haven't heard of any progress on it for a while.

I've used Character profiler w/o any issues that I'm aware of.  Is there something that's missing from the profiler?  I could put it on my to-do list to try to implement.  I'm not the dev for the Profiler, but I can take a look to make it more feature rich for people's needs.

While I admit I just recently tried to use Character Profiler addon, I received an error of "no key found" or something like that, when I tried to open the .lua file in Rawr.  It did correctly identify my character and realm, but when I clicked import it gave me this error.  This ALL was after yesterdays 3.3 patch - so that may well be part of the issue.

I will try again tonight and respond with a more accurate error message if it continues.
It's probable that 3.3 includes several back end changes that affect a large number of add-ons, including Character Profiler. There's most likely an update for it on Curse or something.
So far, no update has been made to Character profiler. Last update was back on May 20th.

Yes, please provide as much detail as possible.

I admit that last night's runs I was running with only a minimal set of addons because of patch day issues, and this included excluding the profiler.  I'll start looking into it more as time goes on.  And if there's a patch I can do, I'll see about working that out for the maintainer of the CharacterProfiler.

as much detail as possible:

  • loaded character profiler, started WOW, loaded my lvl 80.
  • clicked the SAVE button on the (C)haracter window
  • /cp show (says that nothing is scanned, that I need to open bank, talents, bags, etc...) and that it is ON
  • open ALL pages it mentiones, go to bank, etc.
  • /cp show STILL says nothing is scanned. (clicked the SAVE button on the (C)haracter window again)
  • use /cp Export anyway
  • exit WOW
  • run RAWR
  • Load character from character profiler:
  • - get popup confirming Character name, realm,  and click OK
  • get error that says "the given key is not present in dictionary" 0 of 3 tasks completed. oh, and then it hangs Rawr.

I looked in the CharacterProfile.lua - and my bank item info, and LOTS of other stuff is there.... I dont know what the issue is.

I have this problem too.

uncaught exception should be dumped to a log to help debugging

 

follow the exception text when I stop rawr

************** Depuração JIT **************
Para habilitar a depuração just-in-time (JIT), o arquivo .config deste
aplicativo ou computador (machine.config) deve ter o valor
jitDebugging definido na seção system.windows.forms.
O aplicativo também deve ser compilado com a depuração
habilitada.

Por exemplo:

<configuration>
    <system.windows.forms jitDebugging="true" />
</configuration>

Quando a depuração JIT está habilitada, qualquer exceção não tratada
será enviada ao depurador JIT registrado no computador,
em vez de ser tratada nesta caixa de diálogo.

Paul your issue is because you dont have acces rights in Rawr to write to the Item Cache.

We've said time and again DONT PUT RAWR IN PROGRAM FILES.

Jothay wrote:

Paul your issue is because you dont have acces rights in Rawr to write to the Item Cache.

We've said time and again DONT PUT RAWR IN PROGRAM FILES.

While I agree it's far simpler not to use program files (I just dump the folder on my desktop)...I'm surprised Rawr doesn't use the Vista virtual store like most programs that have this issue.
